title: Good Hang Personality Assessment
completionMessage: Assessment complete. Your character is being generated.
scoringPhilosophy: Score 0-10 based on depth, specificity, self-awareness, and vulnerability. There are no right answers - we measure HOW they reflect, not WHAT they say. Reward authentic struggle over polished answers.

sections.title: Your Story
sections.description: We're going to ask about some key moments in your life. There are no right answers - just be honest and specific.
sections.transitionMessage: Thank you for sharing. Now let's explore who you are beneath the surface.

questions.text: Describe a moment or experience that fundamentally changed who you are or how you see the world.
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: specific memory (not vague), clear before/after shift, insight into how it changed them. Reward vulnerability about difficult moments. High scores show the person understands WHY it changed them, not just THAT it did. Red flag: generic life events without personal meaning ('graduating college').

questions.text: Tell me about your single happiest memory.
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: sensory details, emotional specificity, what made it meaningful. The WHAT reveals values (achievement vs connection vs freedom vs peace). Reward memories that show vulnerability or unexpected joy. Red flag: can't pick one, or picks something performative.

questions.text: Tell me about a difficult time in your life and how you got through it.
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: honesty about the difficulty, specific coping mechanisms, growth or learning. Reveals resilience style (endurance vs action vs support-seeking vs reframing). Reward vulnerability about struggle. Red flag: minimizes difficulty, or focuses only on triumph without acknowledging pain.

questions.text: Tell me about something bad that happened to you that ultimately led to something good.
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: genuine adversity (not humble-brag), authentic silver lining (not forced positivity), insight into the transformation. Reveals meaning-making capacity and optimism/pessimism orientation. Reward complexity ('it was both terrible and necessary'). Red flag: can't think of one, or the 'bad' thing is actually good.

sections.title: Who You Are
sections.description: Now let's go deeper into who you are beneath the roles you play.
sections.transitionMessage: Almost there. Finally, let's explore how you connect with others.

questions.text: Tell me about a time you failed someone you care about.
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: accountability (not blaming circumstances), specific impact on the other person, how they carry it now. Reveals moral seriousness and capacity for guilt/growth. Reward genuine remorse without excessive self-flagellation. Red flag: can't think of one, deflects blame, or turns it into a humble-brag.

questions.text: If you stripped away your job, relationships, and achievements - what would remain? What's the core 'you'?
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: answers that go beyond roles and labels, genuine reflection on essential self. Could be values, ways of being, core drives, or honest uncertainty. Reward struggle with the question ('I don't know' + genuine exploration). Red flag: lists achievements anyway, or gives platitudes ('my values').

questions.text: What's a simple thing that matters a lot to you?
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: specific small thing (not 'family' or 'love'), WHY it matters, what it reveals about values. The contrast between 'simple' and 'matters a lot' reveals character. Reward unexpected answers with clear meaning. Red flag: picks something big/obvious, or can't explain why it matters.

sections.title: How You Connect
sections.description: Finally, let's explore how you relate to others and yourself.

questions.text: What do you need from close relationships that you rarely ask for directly?
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: specific unmet need, self-awareness about why they don't ask, vulnerability about longing. Reveals attachment style and emotional honesty. Reward answers that show the gap between need and expression. Red flag: 'nothing' or 'I ask for everything I need' (unlikely), or generic ('support').

questions.text: What's something you believe in intellectually but can't fully commit to in practice?
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: genuine cognitive dissonance, self-awareness about the gap, insight into why commitment fails. Reveals honesty about hypocrisy and where willpower breaks down. Reward specific examples over abstract beliefs. Red flag: claims perfect alignment between beliefs and actions, or picks trivial example ('eating healthy').

questions.text: What's really keeping you from being happy?
questions.scoring_guidance: Look for: honest self-examination, specific barrier (internal or external), awareness of own role in it. Reveals self-knowledge and relationship to happiness. Reward answers that show complexity ('maybe nothing external - it's how I'm wired'). Red flag: 'nothing, I'm happy' (deflection), or blames only external circumstances.
